Pre-Game Insights: Both teams come into this game with a win in their opening matches.
India has a tremendous home record this year and are unbeaten so far on their home soil.
Qatar made their first-ever trip to India and will want to make it a memorable one.
Brandon Fernandes (India) is likely to make a comeback after being injured.
Manvir Singh (India) is injured and not expected to feature in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is expected to be a housefull contest as all tickets have been sold out.
The match will be broadcasted on Sports18 network and livestreamed on JioCinema.
India has never defeated Qatar, and India has conceded just one goal against Qatar in their last two matches.
Both India and Qatar are level on points in Group A (3).
Others: This is the first match for India after a thumping start to their 2026 FIFA World Cup and 2027 AFC Asian Cup joint qualifiers.
The match is significant for both teams as they aim to build momentum in their respective qualifying campaigns.
